text:
What up, yo. It is DJ BBQ for Food
Revolution Day.
I'm at a lovely school in Camden. We've got a plethora of healthy snacks
fruits
porridge, freshly made bread, nuts a plenty man!
This is the best thing you'll ever do. Ready? You throw your berries in there.
Then you throw your strawberries. Your yoghurt.
And then your porridge. That's the porridge I'm using.
That right there will keep you going for
the whole afternoon. Hello. Cupcake Jemma here. I'm here for Food Revolution Day
I am eating a cauliflower right now, and I'm eating it raw. Can you believe it?
It's actually really, really delicious. Not just for cauliflower cheese.
I actually saw a girl the other day eat a head of broccoli on Regents Street,
that was kind of fun. So don't forget to eat vegetables raw. Give it a try.
And then have pudding, in the shape of fruit.

And don't forget to sign the petition
today. So I'm Louis Cole from Fun For Louis

and I'm here supporting the Food
Revolution Day.
Behind me I've got The Happy Pear boys. They've got a table of fresh fruit and veg.
And they've challenged me to do a little blind taste test. Lets try this out.
Here we go Louis. Are you ready? Okay, give me your hand.

Okay here we go. First one here.
Alright I think. Here we go.
okay
That one's not the easiest one to start with. Blackberry? Yes! Nailed!

Nice, nice. Okay round two. Here we go.
Should be easy. It's an easy one.
Strawberry. Yeah man! Yes!
Cherry tomato? That's a good shot. What's that? Melon and a grape. The champion, woo!
Do not forget to sign the petition man. Super important. We need
to start the revolution. How did Jamie Oliver get Paul McCartney?
